subject: Re: [junit] JUnit-JPA (Hibernate) - Spring - Struts2 testing howto
msgSnippet: Hi, Have you looked at Spring integration testing support? http://static.springframework.org/spring/docs/2.5.x/reference/testing.html#testcontext-framework
messageBody:
Hi,

Have you looked at Spring integration testing support?

http://static.springframework.org/spring/docs/2.5.x/reference/testing.html#testcontext-framework

Spring TestContext lets you load an app context, configure
transactions per fixture/method etc.

Cheers
Cenk Çivici

On Wed, Jan 7, 2009 at 1:39 AM, majkic@... <majkic@...> wrote:
> Hi guys,
> I'm new in the group and I couldn't find anything on testing
> combination in the title.
>
> I have applicationContext.xml where EntityManagerFactory is
> configured. Model classes are mapped using Annotations. My service
> classes (DAO - for example BankImpl) implements interfaces (for
> example Bank). Methods from these implementation are called in Struts2
> action classes (injected).
>
> How can I configure my tests to be runnable as single tests and as
> Maven2 tests? Is there any simple example - tutorial? Should I have
> separate applicationContext-test.xml?
>
>
